newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE coffee rebounds to end up, fund sales dry up.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE coffee rebounds to end up, fund sales dry up.

text.p: LIFFE robusta coffee futures flipped up in the afternoon after initial fund selling, which had pressured prices much lower in the morning, ran its course.
After driving prices down by seven percent on Monday in one of the heaviest losses in recent months, the funds continued to liquidate their long positions this morning.
It took benchmark May to a low of $1,515 and ended the morning trade $16 down at $1,525 a tonne.
But the selling abated and the market soon regained its poise in the afternoon after New York headed higher. By the close, May was $26 up on the day at $1,567.
"There was no fund selling in New York and this helped restore some confidence in London," said one trader.
The gains were also underpinned by short-covering ahead of the long Easter weekend and book-squaring before the close of the financial year for some.
Overall volume reached 8,620 lots. May/July switch was again active, standing at $13 over by the close against $20 on Monday.
There was no fresh news and traders said the upward move was also seen as a technical correction to Monday's oversold conditions.
Immediately, the May contract may find support at $1,500-$1,515 while the upside objective is seen at $1,600-$1,610 area.
